sections.title: Introduction / Goal
sections.summary: Presenter states the goal: add more power to GitHub Copilot by using MCP servers and introduces MCP concept.
key_actions: Explain intention to enhance GitHub Copilot with MCP servers
Introduce what MCP servers are (out-of-the-box features)

sections.title: Default MCP Tools Overview
sections.summary: Shows the out-of-the-box MCP tools available by default (two tools) for Copilot.

sections.title: Viewing MCP Servers in Visual Studio and Planning Additions
sections.summary: Opens the Visual Studio list of MCP servers, mentions desired additions (GitHub and Microsoft Learn / Docs) to speed access to documentation.
key_actions: Open Visual Studio MCP servers list
Identify candidate servers to add (GitHub, Microsoft Learn/Docs)
ui_elements: Visual Studio: list of MCP servers

sections.title: Create MCP configuration file in solution
sections.summary: Walks through creating a new MCP configuration file in the solution root (named <name>.mcp.json).
key_actions: Name file as <name>.mcp.json (create file in solution root)

sections.title: Add GitHub MCP server entry
sections.summary: Copies the GitHub server configuration into the MCP JSON file to enable GitHub as an MCP server.
key_actions: Copy GitHub server JSON snippet into the mcp.json file

sections.title: Authentication and Connection Behavior
sections.summary: Explains that the server will appear in cache as not connected and will require authentication; Visual Studio will offer local authenticated credentials to authenticate to GitHub, which then exposes many tools (+90).
key_actions: Trigger authentication for the added server
Select local Visual Studio credential to authenticate with GitHub
Confirm server becomes available and exposes additional tools
ui_elements: Local Visual Studio authenticated credential selector
Server cache state indicator (not connected / requires authentication)

sections.title: Add Microsoft Docs MCP server entry
sections.summary: Adds Microsoft Docs as another MCP server by copying its configuration into the MCP file; presenter notes the configuration is simple.
key_actions: Add Microsoft Docs entry to the mcp.json file

sections.title: Verify Tools in Copilot Chat (Assistant) UI
sections.summary: Opens Copilot chat (assistant mode) tools panel and confirms the presence of the new Microsoft Docs tool along with GitHub Copilot tools.
key_actions: Open Copilot chat in assistant mode
Verify Microsoft Docs tool and GitHub Copilot tools are listed

main_topics: Using MCP servers to extend GitHub Copilot
Creating and editing the <name>.mcp.json configuration file
Adding GitHub and Microsoft Docs as MCP servers
Authentication via Visual Studio credentials for MCP servers
Verifying added tools in the Copilot chat/tools UI
